content: ग्रह् {vI.v} {c9c} <ab>U.</ab> (In Vedic literature ग्रभ्; गृह्णाति, जग्राह, अग्रहीत्, ग्रहीतुं, गृहीत {%<ab>caus.</ab>%} ग्राहयति; {%<ab>desid.</ab>%} जिघृक्षति) {@--1@} To seize, take, take or catch hold of, lay hold of, catch, grasp; तयोर्जगहतुः पादान् राजा राज्ञी च मागधी <ls>R. 1. 57</ls>; आलाने गृह्यते हस्ती वाजी वल्गासु गृह्यते <ls>Mk. 1. 50</ls>; तं कंठे जग्राह <ls>K. 363</ls>; पाणिं गृहीत्वा, चरणं गृहीत्वा &c. {@--2@} To receive, take, accept, exact; प्रजानामेव भूत्यर्थं स ताभ्यो बलिमग्रहीत् <ls>R. 1. 18</ls>; <ls>Ms. 7. 124</ls>; <ls n="Ms.">9. 162.</ls> {@--3@} To apprehend, capture, take prisoner; बंदिग्राहं गृहीत्वा <ls>V. 1</ls>; यांस्तत्र चोरान् गृह्णीयात् <ls>Ms. 8. 34.</ls> {@--4@} To arrest, stop, catch; <ls>Bg. 6. 35.</ls> {@--5@} To captivate, attract; महाराजगृहीतहृदयया मया <ls>V. 4</ls>; हृदये गृह्यते नारी <ls>Mk. 1. 50</ls>; माधुर्यमीष्टे हरिणान् ग्रहीतुं <ls>R. 18. 13.</ls> {@--6@} To win over, persuade, induce to one's side; लुब्धमर्थेन गृह्णीयात् <ls>Chāṇ. 33</ls>; <ls>Pt. 1 69</ls>, <ls n="Pt. 1">184.</ls> {@--7@} (Hence) To please, gratify, satisfy, propitiate; ग्रहीतुमार्यान् परिचर्यया मुहुर्महानुभावाहि नितांतम र्थिनः <ls>Śi. 1. 17.</ls> <ls n="Śi. 1.">33.</ls> {@--8@} To affect, seize or possess (as a demon, spirit &c.); as in पिशचगृहीत, वेताल गृहीत. {@--9@} To assume, take; द्युतिमग्रहीद् ग्रहगणः <ls>Śi. 9. 23</ls>; <ls>Bk. 19. 29.</ls> {@--10@} To learn, know, recognize, understand; <ls>Ki. 10. 8</ls>, <ls>Pt. 1. 43.</ls> {@--11@} To regard, consider, believe, take for; मयापि मृत्पिंडबुद्धिना तथैव गृहीतं <ls>Ś. 6</ls>; परिहासविजल्पितं सखे परमाथेन न गृह्यतां वचः <ls>Ś. 2. 18.</ls> एवं जनो गृह्णाति <ls>M. 1</ls>; <ls>Mu. 3.</ls> {@--12@} To catch or perceive (as by an organ of sense); ज्यानिनादमथ गृह्णती तयोः <ls>R. 11. 15.</ls> {@--13@} To master, grasp, comprehend; <ls>R. 18. 46.</ls> {@--14@} To guess, conjecture, infer; नेत्रवक्त्रविकारैश्च गृह्यतेंऽतर्गतं मनः <ls>Ms. 8. 26.</ls> {@--15@} To utter, mention (as a name); यदि मयान्यस्य नामापि न गृहीतं <ls>K. 305</ls>; न तु नामापि गृह्णीयात् पत्यौ प्रेते परस्य तु <ls>Ms. 5. 157.</ls> {@--16@} To buy, purchase; कियता मूल्येनैतत्पुस्तकं गृहीतं <ls>Pt. 2</ls>; <ls>Y. 2. 169</ls>; <ls>Ms. 8. 201.</ls> {@--17@} To deprive (one) of, take away from, rob or seize away; <ls>Bk. 9. 9</ls>; <ls n="Bk.">15. 63.</ls> {@--18@} To wear, put on (as clothes &c.); वासांसि जीर्णानि यथा विहाय नवानि गृह्णाति नरोऽ पराणि <ls>Bg. 2. 22.</ls> {@--19@} To conceive. {@--20@} To observe (as a fast). {@--21@} To eclipse. {@--22@} To undertake, undergo, begin. {@--23@} To take up, draw (water.) {@--24@} To stop, intercept. {@--25@} To withdraw, draw back. {@--26@} To include. {@--27@} To receive hospitably (as a guest). [The senses of this root may be variously modified according to the noun with which it is joined]. {%--<ab>Caus.</ab>%} {@--1@} To cause to take, catch, seize or accept. {@--2@} To give away in marriage; <ls>Ku. 1. 52</ls> {@--3@} To teach, make one acquainted with. {@--4@} To make one take, deliver over to. {@--5@} To become familiar with. --WITH अनुसं to salute humbly. --अप to take away, tear off. --अभि to seize forcibly. {vII.v} {c1c} <ab>P.</ab> {c10c} <ab>U.</ab> (ग्रहति, ग्राहयति-ते) To take, receive, &c.
